about-me.content: I'm a <0>Full stack</0> developer. I began writing my first lines in C at 15 and have learned a handful of programming languages since - be it in engineering class, for jobs, or just as a hobby. Having a passion for development and computing in general, I try to expand my IT knowledge writing small apps, video games and other oddities listed below. I spend most of my time AFK doing sports and am rarely seen without headphones.

trello.release-video-game: Release a video game on itch.io
trello.presentation: Make a presentation in a conference
trello.manage: Improve my scheduling and management skills

amuse.context: Amuse targets animated shows for pre-school (0-3 years old) children.  Its Paris site handles both production and distribution of such shows on OTT platforms (YouTube, Amazon, Youku, Baidu...). My job in this company focuses on production and distribution pipelines, enabling artists delivering as fast and effective as possible.
amuse.bloc1: As a Chief Technical Officer I play an active role in every phase for all our projects : product design, team management, day-to-day operations, developement...
amuse.bloc2: Managing a pluridisciplinary team of six
amuse.bloc3: Implemented a 'pipeline' creation app with such languages/frameworks as
amuse.bloc6: Implemented a Ruby on rails-based video distribution app
amuse.bloc1-1: Enhanced and maintained the company's tool managing production and distribution pipelines (Ruby on Rails).
amuse.bloc1-5: Developed a GraphQL API exposing our data to Shotgun Software
amuse.bloc1-7: an automated job application software for artists (Rails + ActiveAdmin)

applidget.bloc: Developed and maintained the company's main project, a guest registration and check-in application for professional event organizers (Ruby/ReactJS).

masa.bloc: Helped optimizing a 3D military simulation written in C++/OpenGL. Brought new features as well as a more intuitive UX.

multiposting.bloc1: Maintained various PHP and Python-based tools
multiposting.bloc2: Developed focus crawlers for employment websites

arles.bloc1: Helped the mayor's office issuing their official statements with a PHP website.
arles.bloc2: Groomed and upgraded the local administration's database.

skills.legend: Click on doughnut chart for more information
